Name: Roundel
Description: The centre of this roundel depicts a horseman with a nimbus. He is galloping towards the left with a weapon in his left hand and a small shield (?) in his right. The scene also depicts a bird, two gazelles, and a human head. The horseman is a very popular motif in Coptic textile art. Associated with hunting and the image of the invincible emperor, he personifies the victory of good over evil. The iconography of this fabric is influenced by Syrian, Byzantine and Alexandrian silks from the sixth to eighth centuries.
